intro: Staelia virgata var. killeenii, commonly known as the Killeen's staelia, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
